Psilotum nudum (L.) Beauv. 科名：PSILOTACEAE
中文名：松葉蕨
和名：マツバラン
Description
Aerial stems green, erect or pendent, 10-50 cm long, angular; leaves awl-shaped, 1-2 mm long. Widely distributed in tropics and subtropics. Terrestrial or more often epiphytic; small plants usually erect; large plants pendent.
植株高約10-50cm，莖綠色，典型二叉分枝，孢子囊三枚合生。 遍佈熱帶、亞熱帶地區。在臺灣常見於筆筒樹的樹幹上。全國低海拔地區皆可見，但數量不多。
Specimen collections
TAIPEI: Tatungshan, Kuo 2334*. IISINCHU: Manabashan, Do 725. NANTOU: Chingshuikou, Huang 1940. PINGTUNG: Nanjenshan, Kao 73440. TAITUNG: Tawu, Chuang 3461; Is. Lanyu, Huang & Kao 5458. HUALIEN: Chingshuishan, Nakamura 3578
Epiphytic habitat on the Ficus microcarpa tree (photo by Lin, Cheng-Tao)
Spore (photo by Lin, Cheng-Tao)

Lycopodium carinatum Desv. LYCOPODIACEAE
覆葉石松
Description
Epiphytes, pendent; stems 65-80 cm long, 3-5 mm in diameter, forking. Leaves lanceolate, 7-10 mm long, pointing towards apex, appressed decreasing in size towards apex and merging intosporophylls. Fertile spikes 2, terminal, 10-15 cm long, 3 mm thick.
Distributed in tropical Asia, Hainan, the Ryukyus, Taiwan and Polynesia. Epiphytic in mountain forests.
Specimen collections
ILAN: Mt. Oobi, Masamune s. n. 1938. PINGTUNG: Mutan, Kawakami 2335; Neiwen, Hsu 11732.
TAITUNG: Tawu, Shieh 107; Kibisha-Mizuho, Yamamoto 164.

Lycopodium casuarinoides Spring LYCOPODIACEAE
木賊葉石松
Synonyms
Lycopodium casuarinoides Spring var. japonicum Nakai in Bot. Mag. Tokyo 46: 63. 1932; Masamune, Short F1. Form. 31. 1936.
Description
Main stem terete scandent, reaching to the tops of trees, much branched; aerial stem with small, widely spaced scales similar to those on rhizome; ultimate leafy branches flattened, dichotomously forking; ultimate sterile branchlets widely spreading, 5-10 cm long; ultimate fertile franchlets in long subparallel sprays, 15-25 cm long. Vegetative leaves dimorphic on sterile branches, adnate most their lengths, free tips of the curved lateral sterile leaves 2-3 mm long; free tips of fertile leaves 1 mm long or less. Strobili 10-15 mm long, borne in large numbers on lateral much forked branches; sporophylls broadly ovate with an acuminate or caudate tip, the margins erose. Distributed from tropical Asia to southern Japan. Scandent on trees and bushes in mountain peaks.
Specimen collections
TAIPEI: Niaotsueichienshan, DeVol 8347; Chutzhu, Simada 982. ILAN: Taipingshan, Shieh & Tsai 7487*. NANTOU: Kuantaochi, Kuo 2032. CHIAYI: Mt. Alishan, Kao 7487. PINGTUNG: Machia, Huang & Kao 7385.

d:dictionary.d:entry:
LYCOPODIACEAE 石松科
TSAI, JINN-LAI and SHIEH, WANG-CHUENG
Terrestrial, scrambling on epiphytic vascular plants with aerial stems usually branching. Leaves small, simple, spirally arranged or imbricate or subverticillate, with a single median vein. Sporangia solitary, in axils of normal leaves or in terminal spikes forming strobili. Spores minute, homosporous. A family of two genera and about 250 species, abundant in tropical and subtropical forests; one genus and 23 species (incl. 2 varieties) in Taiwan.
懸垂性、附生、或地生性，植株具地上或地下生之根莖，二叉分支。 葉小型，螺旋排列、輪生或十字對生， 小葉僅具單脈。孢子葉集生在枝條末端，或和營養葉混生。
台灣有3屬23種。
LITERATURE
DeVol, C. E. 1965. The Pteidophypta of Taiwan 2. Taiwania 11: 41-55.
Kuo, C. M. 1985. Taxonomy and phytogeogaphy of Taiwanese pteridophytes, Taiwania 30: 5-100.
1. LYCOPODIUM L. 石松屬 Stems erect, pendent, creeping or scandent. Leaves microphyllous, usually monomorphous, mostly in close spirals, whorls, or opposite pairs and decussate. Sporangia sessile to short-stalked, usually reniform, single on the adaxial surface of a sporophyll, similar to sterile leaves or quite different, usually near the base, or on the stem near the axile; sporophylls variable in size and when minute the axis usually much condensed with the numerous sporophylls forming a strobilus; strobili sessile or peduncled. Spores yellow, variously reticulate or sculptured. About 240 species with 21 taxa in Taiwan.

PSILOTACEAE 松葉蕨科 DEVOL, CHARLES E. and SHIEH, WANG-CHUENG
Vascular plants without roots; stems erect or pendent, dichotomously or unbranched; rhizomes mycorrhizal, with a protostele; aerial stem with a siphonostele. Leaves scale-like, lacking midrib, or elliptical with midrib. Sporangia borne in axils of leaves, 2-3 lobed, eusporangiate, homosporous. Gametophyte subterranean, cylindrical, mycorrhizal.
Two living genera, one in Taiwan.

Genus PSILOTUM Sw. 松葉蕨屬
Rhizome bearing rhizoids; aerial stems simple below, repeatedly dichotomously branching above. Leaves small, scale-like, scattered, veinless. Sporangia 3-lobed, on adaxial side of the minute leaves; spores bilateral.
Three species, one in Taiwan.
Species Psilotum nudum 松葉蕨

d:entry.d:title: Front/Back Matter
d:entry.div: This is Flora of Taiwan 2 dictionary.

To see this page,
Open "Go" menu.
Choose "Front/Back Matter" menu item. If it has sub-menu items, choose one of them.

To prepare the menu item, do the followings.
Prepare this page source as an entry.
Add "DCSDictionaryFrontMatterReferenceID" key and its value to the plist of the dictionary. The value should be the string of this page entry id.
